column3: AutoHotkey time constants and few "time marks" based on AutoHotkey time constants.
It is possible to combine them.

column1: *‖ADDD/‖SI‖En‖A_DDD‖Current day of the week's abbreviation in the current user's language, e.g. Sun
*‖ADDDD/‖SI‖En‖A_DDDD‖Current day of the week's full name in the current user's language, e.g. Sunday
*‖AMMM/‖SI‖En‖A_MMM‖Current month's abbreviation in the current user's language, e.g
*‖AMMMM/‖SI‖En‖A_MMMM‖Current month's full name in the current user's language, e.g. J
*‖ANow/‖SI‖En‖A_Now‖The current local time in YYYYMMDDHH24MISS format.
*‖ANowUTC‖SI‖En‖A_NowUTC‖The current Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) in YYYYMMDDHH24MISS format. UTC = GMT.
*‖ATickCount‖SI‖En‖A_TickCount‖The number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the system was started.
*‖AWDay‖SI‖En‖A_WDay‖Current 1-digit day of the week (1-7). 1 is Sunday in all locales.
*‖AYWeek‖SI‖En‖A_YWeek‖Current year and week number (e.g. 200453) according to ISO 8601.
